summary: "Automatic stabilizers" adjust federal spending and taxes during an economic downturn. These budget mechanisms can help keep the economy afloat when unemployment is high and incomes fall. Our Q&A report documents the effects of automatic stabilizers in recent economic downturns. Specifically, they: Prevented the economy from getting worse by generating additional economic activity Helped support people's wellbeing by alleviating poverty and improving nutrition through government...
title: Economic Downturns: Effects of Automatic Spending Programs and Taxes
